title: (x) Lubalin favourite extreme contrast modern serif - Pistilli Roman (Didoni) {Mark S}
content:
Here is a often used by Herb Lubalin. Does anyone here know it by name?

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20071009062244im_/http:/typophile.com/files/bcde.jpg)

 [‹ (x) New York Times Magazine headlines - custom Cheltenham by Matthew Carter {Yves}](http://web.archive.org/web/20071009062244/http:/typophile.com/node/18339 "Go to previous forum topic") [Various Nuttelex margarine signage from Australia ›](http://web.archive.org/web/20071009062244/http:/typophile.com/node/18330 "Go to next forum topic")
author: Varglarsen

comments.content:
It’s Pistilli Roman, which hasn’t yet been digitized. Phil Martin’s [Didoni](http://web.archive.org/web/20071009062244/http:/www.fontshop.com/index.cfm?fuseaction=catalog.fontdetail&displayfontid=UR.109805.0.0) is a close copy, but the digital version’s hairlines are not nearly as thin.

Phil’s version was not a straight knock-off. He added a bunch of swash and alternate characters. Ironically, Phil’s contributions are missing from the URW digitization, so what you get is essentially just a knock-off of Pistilli Roman.
Thanks. Shame about the hairlines... really like Pistillis contrast
